walkthroughs.title: Getting Started with Alex
walkthroughs.description: Set up your cognitive learning partner and start building knowledge

steps.title: Meet Alex
steps.description:
Alex is your cognitive learning partner â€” an AI architecture that learns, remembers, and grows with you across projects.

Alex has **77 skills**, **persistent memory**, and **cross-project knowledge sharing**.

steps.title: Initialize Architecture
steps.description:
Deploy the cognitive architecture to your workspace. This creates memory files, skills, and synaptic connections.

[Initialize Architecture](command:alex.initialize)

steps.title: Chat with @alex
steps.description:
Open GitHub Copilot Chat and type `@alex` to start a conversation.

Try: `@alex /status` to check your architecture health.

steps.title: Set Up Your Profile
steps.description:
Personalize Alex by setting your learning preferences, expertise areas, and communication style.

Try: `@alex /profile`

steps.title: Consolidate Knowledge
steps.description:
Use `/meditate` to consolidate what you've learned into persistent memory files.

Try: `@alex /meditate I learned about design patterns today`

steps.title: Run Neural Maintenance
steps.description:
Keep Alex healthy by running the Dream protocol â€” it validates synapses and repairs broken connections.

[Run Dream Protocol](command:alex.dream)

walkthroughs.title: Global Knowledge Setup
walkthroughs.description: Share learnings across all your projects with a Git-based knowledge repository

steps.title: What is Global Knowledge?
steps.description:
Global Knowledge lets Alex share patterns and insights across all your projects. Learnings from one project automatically benefit every other project.

It's powered by a simple Git repository â€” no cloud services required.

steps.title: Create a Knowledge Repository
steps.description:
Create a new GitHub repository named `Alex-Global-Knowledge` (or any name) and clone it next to your workspace.

Alex auto-detects sibling folders with `index.json` + `patterns/` + `insights/`.

steps.title: First Sync
steps.description:
Once set up, try syncing your knowledge:

Try: `@alex /sync`

This merges local and remote knowledge bidirectionally.

steps.title: Save Your First Insight
steps.description:
Capture a valuable learning for use across projects:

Try: `@alex /saveinsight` after discovering something useful.

walkthroughs.title: Voice & Text-to-Speech
walkthroughs.description: Let Alex read responses aloud with configurable voice synthesis

steps.title: About Voice Mode
steps.description: Alex can read responses aloud using text-to-speech synthesis. This is useful for accessibility, hands-free coding, or reviewing long documents.

steps.title: Configure Voice
steps.description:
Voice is powered by your system's speech synthesis engine. Try the Read Aloud command:

[Read Aloud](command:alex.readAloud)

steps.title: Try It Out
steps.description:
Select some text in your editor, then right-click and choose **Ask Alex** to get a spoken response.

Or use: `@alex read this file aloud`

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run sync-architecture && npm run clean && npm run package
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run lint
scripts.deploy:local: npm run clean && npm run compile && node -e "require('fs').readdirSync('.').filter(f=>f.endsWith('.vsix')).forEach(f=>{require('fs').unlinkSync(f);console.log('Removed old '+f)})" && npx vsce package --no-dependencies && node -e "const f=require('fs').readdirSync('.').filter(x=>x.endsWith('.vsix')).sort().pop();if(f){console.log('Installing '+f);require('child_process').execSync('code --install-extension '+f+' --force',{stdio:'inherit'})}else{process.exit(1)}"
